Opportunity Standard
v0.0.0-19

The Opportunity Standard is currently a work-in-progress. Please reach out to products@nycopportunity.nyc.gov with any questions.

Languages

Select Element

@nycopportunity/standard/src/objects/languages

Demonstration
Code
<div class="select " for="c623013e80e27">
  <select id="c623013e80e27" name="select['c623013e80e27']" required="true">
    <option value="languages">Languages</option>
    <option value="es">Español</option>
    <option value="ru">Русский</option>
    <option value="ko">한국어</option>
    <option value="ar">العربية</option>
    <option value="ht">Kreyol</option>
    <option value="zh-CN">繁體中文</option>
    <option value="fr">Français</option>
    <option value="pl">polski</option>
    <option value="ur">اردو</option>
    <option value="bn">বাংলা</option>
  </select>
  <svg aria-hidden="true" class="select__graphic" style="stroke: currentColor">
    <use href="#nyco-languages"></use>
  </svg>
</div>

The City of New York is committed to ensuring that New Yorkers who have limited English proficiency (LEP) are able to access information, programs, and services offered by NYC government. … The 10 designated Citywide languages under Local Law 30 are Spanish, Chinese, Russian, Bengali, Haitian, Korean, Arabic, Urdu, French, and Polish. … Local Law 30 requires MOIA and the Mayor’s Office of Operations to use Census data to determine the top six languages spoken by New Yorkers with limited English proficiency, and to use NYC Department of Education data to determine the next four languages spoken by New Yorkers with limited English proficiency.

Learn more about the City’s language access practices.

Following guidance from the U.S. Web Design System the label for the language selector is “Languages.”

Dropdown

@nycopportunity/standard/src/objects/languages

Demonstration

Select a language

  • English
  • Español
  • Русский
  • 한국어
  • العربية
  • Kreyol
  • 繁體中文
  • Français
  • polski
  • اردو
  • বাংলা

Code
<div class="o-languages-dropdown " data-js="languages-dropdown" id="aria-c-languages-dropdown">
  <div class="o-languages-dropdown__inner">
    <div>
      <div class="text-end">
        <button aria-controls="aria-c-languages-dropdown" aria-expanded="false" class="btn btn-primary btn-small" data-dialog="close" data-js="dialog">
          <svg aria-hidden="true" class="icon-ui">
            <use href="#lucide-x"></use>
          </svg>
          <span>Close</span>
          <span class="sr-only">and return to site</span>
        </button>
      </div>
      <p class="h4 block w-full m-0 py-2 text-alt">Select a language</p>
      <div class="o-languages-dropdown__options">
        <div class="o-languages-dropdown__languages">
          <div>
            <ul>
              <li>
                <a href="https://nycopportunity.github.io/standard/demos/index">
                  <span>English</span>
                </a>
              </li>
              <li>
                <a href="https://nycopportunity.github.io/standard/demos/es">
                  <span>Español</span>
                </a>
              </li>

                  <span>Русский</span>
                </a>
              </li>

        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

The Languages Dropdown uses a Dropdown Component to display text controls that are available for the application.
